text: The 2011 ADAC Procar Series season was the seventeenth season of the ADAC Procar Series, the German championship for Super 2000 touring cars. The season consisted of eight separate race weekends with two races each, spread over seven different tracks. ==Teams and drivers== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%" !Team !Car ! !Drivers !Rounds |- !colspan=5| Division 1 |- | Liqui Moly Team Engstler | BMW 320si E90 | 2 | Johannes Leidinger | All |- |rowspan=3| Yaco Racing |rowspan=3| Toyota Auris S2000 | 7 | Charlie Geipel | 8 |- | 8 | Lorenz Frey | 1–2, 4–5 |- | 9 | Michail Stepanov | All |- |rowspan=4| Rikli Motorsport | Mercedes-Benz C200 | 10 | Michel Zemp | 4 |- | Honda Accord Euro R | 11 | Christian Fischer | All |- | Honda Civic FD | 12 | Peter Rikli | All |- | BMW 320i E46 | 16 | Markus Huggler | 8 |- | Thate Motorsport | BMW 320si E90 | 14 | Jens Guido Weimann | All |- | Polar Seafood Racing | Renault Clio | 15 | Thomas Fjordbach | 1 |- | K&K;
